comments:
Another of my classes causes the same out of bounds exceptions described in bug
#105876, but does not draw the bounding boxes. It shows only a box with what
looks like a broken widget icon labelled "this". Clicking on the components (who
also have broken red-x icons on them) in the bean view/browser, results in
another exception being thrown:

What is the class that you open? What does it inherit from? What JRE are you
using? Could you please attach your class as an attachment so that we can see it?

Created an attachment (id=25951)
Test case for "locale needed"

Extracted text case exemplifying this bug. For some reason the two labels in
the title panel are intertwined and I couldn't figure out exactly how or why,
but changing them further (or commenting out a few lines) will make the bug
disappear.

This shows up in both Java 1.4.2 and 1.5.0. I can include my full Eclipse config
info if you need more info here, just let me know.

Moving this file out of my existing code tree, removing the package, and finally
restarting Eclipse, causes it to go away. Is there some cached file/data
somewhere  in the project that could be causing this? (I used VE in Eclipse 3.0)

Heh, strike that. It doesn't work even when moving it out of the code tree. It
just changes.

The exceptions aren't thrown in the error log and the elements aren't marked in
the bean view with exception icons, but it still isn't quite right. Now it
actually renders the title panel below a "java beans icon labeled 'this'" (as
opposed to the standard 'error' icon labeled 'this').

It should still be rendering the dialog correctly, with the title panel inside
it, shouldn't it?

Thanks for finding this.

The fix has been released to HEAD.
*** Bug 110532 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
